text:
only real things to add to this are:

- “Spoilers” view by default (aka what the current site looks like), but we could easily add a table view of the content
- All the left column filters are on the dataset (ES filters), but we can add some client-side filters in the thin navbar under the graphs
- Not 100% on which graphs we should show, should probably discuss this a bit more.  To be specific, I think the histograms I posted earlier look cool, but I’d rather just have textboxes with min/max on the left and show the histograms elsewhere… at which point I’m like, do we really need to show one histogram for each type?
maybe that should be another view, “graph view”
also my plan was to initially implement commander pages and then generalize to cards/tribes
also wrote down these unrelated thoughts while brainstorming:
let me know what you do / don’t like and if I should adjust my plan, otherwise I’ll work on getting something like that mockup built
wonder if I could use the wordpress api to make a tag for every card name so that authors don’t keep messing them up
the problem with that is casual mentions
like… “After last week’s article on Omnath, Locus of Mana, I wanted to take this a different direction and talk about…”
You could have it so it generates at a button click instead of automatically, the. You can just edit what doesn't actually fit
no I meant making tags like #Omnath, #Locus of Mana instead of #omnath locus of mana
oh
and I’m almost done making this happen
sorry i misunderstood
yeah that sounds good
just not worth the time for me to keep fixing tags lol
getting the script to authenticate to do POSTs wasn’t even that bad
thats scary
what’s scary?
nevermind
the script was easy, authenticating wasnt hopefully
setting up authentication was easy
and more secure than most things we do
wer
d
speaking of which
we need to run updates on the box
it has been like 2 years
ha
how should we handle this
rebooting this thing scares the shit out of me
1. back up EVERYTHING
2. document what the process is for rebooting this thing
like what things we need to make sure are running
3. get a list of all the packages that are installed (yum and pip)
4. reboot and pray to jeff bezos the thing comes back up
5. do this at a time where we have plenty of time to fix anything
is there anyway we could do something like
copy the aws instance
do it on the copy
yeah fo sho
replace the original once we’re sure it’s good?
well
cause even if things go perfectly the website will be down for some time
actually the only thing we should hae to reboot on is the kernel
we should update everything else and we wont need to reboot
what we could do is test our backup
haha
basically pretend like the box got nuked and see if we can restore everything from nothing
yeah, take a backup and update it / reboot it / fix whatever needs fixing
then we can either replace the original with the backup or follow the same process
i’d say do a backup exercise
and restore from backup on a new host
document everything you had to do on the way to get it back up
then once the backup is running nicely we can just switch over
kill the old box
sounds good
i bet you’ll find some things we aren’t backing up
oh man
the database is going to be an absolute fucking nightmare if we aren’t doing it right
are we using pgdump?
think so
ok maybe wontb e so bad
we’ll see!
`pg_dump -U postgres --compress=9 > /home/ec2-user/backup.dump`
ok cool
that shouldn’t be too bad then
k i gotta getb ack to work, ive got about 5 hours of work to do in 2 hrs
ill be up late tonight
so wait I was saying to make a copy of the current instance, but do you want a fresh instance and for me to bring over db/git/config files one by one?
assume that the EBS volume got corrupted
and the box shut down
practice restoring to a brand new fresh ec2 instance
so the latter
ok
try to restore without touching the box directly
yeah
mission impossible
like, you may find that the nginx conf isn’t being backed up
so now we back that up
makes sense
good luck with your 2 hours lol
just a normal day on the don train
